ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la zɔ́ʼɔ tsɔ̌ míŋ Falahoŋ wemanzwě, ńcʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tákẅìʼ Falahoŋ gẅie aa fùɔ ngwòŋ Egíbtò, pɔ́ manzwě la gʉa né jʉʼ gie mé tóŋ lê tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavîd, ńtsẅé wó tá ńdɔg ńzẅíʼte páʼ Salémo ge mege nɔʼ yé kwɛ́, é mege ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kwɛ́, é piŋ mege metʉ̂ankáʼ mie é kéle Yelúzálèm é kwɛ́.
en: Solomon made an alliance   with Pharaoh king of Egypt by marrying Pharaoh’s daughter.  # 3:1 Dt 7:3; 1Kg 7:8; 9:24; Ezr 9:14 Solomon brought her to the city of David  # 3:1 2Sm 5:7; 7:8; 9:10 until he finished building his palace,  # 3:1 2Sm 7:1–2 the Lord’s temple,  # 3:1 2Sm 6:1,14; 1Kg 6:37; 7:51 and the wall surrounding Jerusalem.  # 3:1 1Kg 9:15

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ ayɛ̌, aláʼ né ńnuŋe pwɔʼ wɔ́b pɔ́ na mejʉʼʉ ssé, ńtí páʼ á la gwaa gwɔ́, mé nyé té kwɛ́ ndá gie ngwɔ́ mé guʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wó.
en: However, the people were sacrificing on the high places,   because until that time a temple for the Lord’s name  # 3:2 Dt 14:23 had not been built.

ngiemboon: Salémo nyɛ ye ntí lélɔg ńkwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò na mentÿɔgɔ́ tá we fùɔ Ndavîd. Tá ńdáʼ ngie kwaʼ yé lɔ̌ɔn ńzẅé menɔ̀ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńnuŋe mepwɔʼ, ńtuɔ mbɔɔ lìi na mejʉʼʉ ssé.
en: Solomon loved the Lord    by walking in the statutes of his father David,  # 3:3 1Kg 3:14 but he also sacrificed and burned incense on the high places.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, afùɔ Salémo gʉa Ngambahoŋ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńtí nue á laa jʉʼʉ ssé lÿò gie á laa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ, mbà Salémo la láʼ ńná menɔ̀ɔn na yɛ̌ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ gie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm wó, é tàʼ ntsáʼ.
en: The king went to Gibeon   to sacrifice there because it was the most famous high place. He offered a thousand burnt offerings on that altar.  # 3:4 2Ch 1:3,6

ngiemboon: E Ssé la tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿòon letsẅɛ́ʼ lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́, ńgɔɔn né Salémo ngie: «Lúɔ jú mmó gie ɔ̀ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, n ná né gù.»
en: At Gibeon the Lord appeared to Solomon   in a dream at night.  # 3:5 Nm 12:6; 1Kg 9:2; 11:9 God said, “Ask.  # 3:5 Mt 7:7; Jn 15:7 What should I give you? ”

ngiemboon: Salémo tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Ɔ̀ ka lɔgɔ pyennɛ́, ńdíe ngàŋafàʼ gù fùɔ Ndavîd gẅie aa tá wɔ̀ɔn, ńtí nue pi yé la néŋe, á gwɔ́ nyìŋ mekùʼ, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa nò nénʉ́, ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ. Ɔ̀ ka nyɛɛ pyennɛ́ jú nzèm yé, ḿbiŋ ńnáa tàʼ múɔ mbàŋa né yé, tà múɔ mbàŋa ŋwɛ́ néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ yé, páʼ mé ne ńgyá lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn lɛ̂.
en: And Solomon replied, “You have shown great and faithful love to your servant, my father David, because he walked before you in faithfulness, righteousness, and integrity.   You have continued this great and faithful love for him by giving him a son to sit on his throne,  # 3:6 1Kg 1:48 as it is today.  # 3:6 1Kg 2:4; 9:4; 2Ch 1:8

ngiemboon: Oon, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, gù zɔ la lɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ńgÿo fùɔ, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ngàŋafàʼ gù, n kúbe twó tá wɔ̀ɔn fùɔ Ndavîd. N nyě ńkɔ́g tɛʼ lézsé páʼ ngwɔ́ e faʼa yɔɔn fàʼ púʼu.
en: “Lord my God, you have now made your servant king in my father David’s place.   Yet I am just a youth with no experience in leadership.  # 3:7 Lit am a little youth and do not know to go out or come in,# 3:7 1Ch 29:1; Jr 1:6–7

ngiemboon: N tyé twómvfò na láʼ gie ɔ̀ la tsɔ́ʼ. Áa láʼ ńgyɔ́ɔn, á gyɔ́ɔn tà lesáŋ tà ńzsé nzẅìŋ te wó wɔ́.
en: Your servant is among your people you have chosen,   a people too many to be numbered or counted.  # 3:8 Gn 15:5; 22:17

ngiemboon: Náa wɔ́ɔn zsénò, ńdɔg sáʼa láʼ jú, ńdɔg ńtyɛʼte nò mbòŋo na yetepòŋ. Á lɔɔn te púʼu wɔ́, mbà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ nyìŋ kuʼu lésáʼa láʼ gie á gyɔ́ɔn nzẅìŋ wɔɔn?»
en: So give your servant a receptive heart to judge   your people and to discern between good and evil. For who is able to judge this great people of yours? ”  # 3:9 2Ch 1:10

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la zɛ́te púʼu, anò poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Now it pleased the Lord that Solomon had requested this.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, e Ssé tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó fùɔ ngie: «Ɔ̀ kaa lúɔ ngie mèŋ kẅiʼi menzẅìŋ ngùʼ mú wɔ́, ńké te lúɔ fùʼ wɔ́, ńké te lúɔ ngie n zẅé mengàŋmbù pú wɔ́, páʼ ɔ̀ lǔɔ pɔ́ zsénò lélɔg sáʼa láʼ ndʉŋndʉŋ la,
en: So God said to him, “Because you have requested this and did not ask for long life   or riches for yourself,  # 3:11 Jms 4:3 or the death  # 3:11 Lit life of your enemies, but you asked discernment for yourself to administer justice,  # 3:11 1Ch 22:12

ngiemboon: n ge náa mbwó gù. Ɔ̀ ge gẅiin zsénò pɔ́ legye, tà e gwɔ́ sie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ zɔɔn laa gẅiin, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ piŋ ńké le láʼ ńgẅiin páʼ gù wɔ́.
en: I will therefore do what you have asked.   I will give you a wise and understanding heart, so that there has never been anyone like you before and never will be again.  # 3:12 1Kg 4:29–31; 10:23–24

ngiemboon: N ge ná mbɔɔ mmó gie ɔ̀ zɔ̌ɔn kaa lúɔ, é náa fùʼ mbɔɔ legúʼ, tà à láʼ ńgwɔ́ na mú menzẅìŋ ngùʼ lélɔg ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, à tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ mefùɔ láʼ le gú sẅé.
en: In addition, I will give you what you did not ask for: both riches and honor,   so that no king will be your equal during your entire life.  # 3:13 1Kg 10:23

ngiemboon: Ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgiŋ páʼ n ne ńkwoŋo, ńgiŋ páʼ membʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn, mbɔɔ mentÿɔgɔ́ mɔ́ɔn ne ńzɛ́te, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ tá gù fùɔ Ndavîd, mbà n ge kẅiʼi nzẅìŋ melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mú.»
en: If you walk in my ways and keep my statutes and commands just as your father David did, I will give you a long life.”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo zyeen, ńgyá é gwɔ́ pɔ́ njÿòon. Á piŋ nzèm né Yelúzálèm, ńgʉa ńtyé mvfò kʉbé kʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó ntsèm, ńgíŋ ńnuŋe pwɔʼ mbʉ́lè, ḿbiŋ ńtóŋ megàŋafàʼ pé, ńdyé wɔ́b.
en: Then Solomon woke up   and realized it had been a dream.  # 3:15 Dn 2:3; 4:5 He went to Jerusalem, stood before the ark of the Lord’s covenant,  # 3:15 2Sm 6:12 and offered burnt offerings and fellowship offerings.  # 3:15 1Sm 11:15 Then he held a feast  # 3:15 1Kg 8:65 for all his servants.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, etsɔ̌ panzwě mépʉ́a pie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pakáatÿǒ tóo mvfò fùɔ.
en: Then two women who were prostitutes came to the king and stood before him.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ tàʼ na pɔ́b gɔɔn ngie: Ankwɔbɔ́, tsetsɔ́ʼ, mé júʼu nò gie n ge gɔɔn: Peg manzwě wɔɔn tsẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tàʼ ndá, mbà n ka zyě pɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ yé.
en: One woman said, “Please, my lord, this woman and I live in the same house, and I had a baby while she was in the house.

ngiemboon: N da zyé púʼu, é gwaa cʉa lyɛ̌ʼ tá, á zyé yé. Peg yé mépʉ́a zɔ ké ńtsẅé ndá, tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ te gíŋ ńgwɔ́ ndá wɔ́.
en: On the third day after I gave birth, she also had a baby and we were alone. No one else   was with us in the house; just the two of us were there.

ngiemboon: Á ně ńgwɔ́ letsẅɛ́ʼ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, á nuŋe na we múɔ, á kwé.
en: During the night this woman’s son died because she lay on him.

ngiemboon: Á lu ssé tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́ʼ, tà n nyé ńdye lyě, ńkaa we múɔ gẅie á kwě, ńnáʼte, ńtó, ńnuŋe lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, ńkaa wɔ̀ɔn gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ ńdɔg ńgʉa ńnuŋe lejʉ́ŋ yé.
en: She got up in the middle of the night and took my son from my side while your servant was asleep. She laid him in her arms, and she put her dead son in my arms.

ngiemboon: N ně ḿbiŋ ńdu ssé mbaʼámbaʼ, ngie n gee ńnóŋ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, ńgyá mbà à kwě, n cwoŋo ńdíe yé, ńgyá à te míŋ wɔ̀ɔn gẅie n ka zyé wɔ́.
en: When I got up in the morning to nurse my son, I discovered he was dead. That morning, when I looked closely at him I realized that he was not the son I gave birth to.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, wetsɔ̌ manzwě zye légaʼte ńgɔɔn ngie: «Á té nò wɔ́! Múɔ gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ aa míŋ wɔ̀ɔn! À gù múɔ aa gẅie à kwě!» Táʼ, andùŋmvfò pʉŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ngǎŋ! Agù múɔ aa gẅie à kwě! Múɔ gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ aa míŋ wɔ̀ɔn!» Wɔɔn aa páʼ pɔ́ la tyé mvfò fùɔ ńne ńzoŋo púʼu.
en: “No,” the other woman said. “My son is the living one; your son is the dead one.”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ la zẅíʼte tà ńgɔɔn ngie: «Wɔɔn nyìŋ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: “Múɔ gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ aa míŋ wɔ̀ɔn! À gù múɔ aa gẅie à kwě!” Agẅi nyìŋ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: “À gù múɔ aa gẅie à kwě! Múɔ gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ aa míŋ wɔ̀ɔn!”
en: The king replied, “This woman says, ‘This is my son who is alive, and your son is dead,’ but that woman says, ‘No, your son is dead, and my son is alive.’ ”

ngiemboon: Páʼ á gwɔ́ pɛ́ʼɛ̀ la, mé gʉa faʼ nně ncù ńdɔg ńtó ńná né mèŋ.» Mé faʼ ńdɔg ńtó,
en: The king continued, “Bring me a sword.” So they brought the sword to the king.

ngiemboon: afùɔ gɔɔn ngie: «Pi záʼa múɔ gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ tsetsɛ̀ɛ à kẅɛ nzsè pʉ́a, wɔɔn nyìŋ gẅiin tàʼa kèm, gẅi nyìŋ gẅiin yetsɔ́.»
en: And the king said, “Cut the living boy in two and give half to one and half to the other.”

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, má pà múɔ gẅie à laa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ júʼ, mezìŋe míŋ we kúu yé, á gɔɔn né fùɔ ngie: «Ankwɔbɔ́, tsetsɔ́ʼ! Mé pɔ́ɔn lézẅé yé, mé náa yé né manzwě wɔɔn!» Táʼ, wetsɔ̌ manzwě gɔɔn ngie: «Pi záʼa yé nzsè pʉ́a, peg yé pú sɔ́ɔn.»
en: The woman whose son was alive spoke to the king because she felt great compassion  ,# 3:26 Gn 43:30; Jr 31:20; Hs 11:8 for her son. “My lord, give her the living baby,” she said, “but please don’t have him killed! ”

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, afùɔ gɔɔn ngie: «Pi pɔ́ɔn lézẅé múɔ, Pi náa yé mbwó manzwě gẅie à vɔ̌g ńgɔɔn nò, yé zɔɔ má pà múɔ gẅie aa ntʉ̀ntʉ̀.»
en: The king responded, “Give the living baby to the first woman, and don’t kill him. She is his mother.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm la júʼ ntí gie fùɔ Salémo ka lɔg ńzáʼ yɔɔn ntsaŋ, ḿbú ḿbɔ́gɔ yé, ńtí nue pɔ́ la gyá ngie Ssé ka náa zsénò né yé lélɔg sáʼ ntsaŋ ndʉŋndʉŋ.
en: All Israel heard about the judgment the king had given, and they stood in awe of the king because they saw that God’s wisdom   was in him to carry out justice.
